intro: Hypogomphia turkestanica var. elatior, commonly known as the Turkistan hypogomphia, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly studied species.
